title: How to Make a Passport Holder

steps.headline: Cut out 10 centimeter (3.9 in) x 17 centimeter (6.7 in) outside fabric and lining fabric.
steps.description: Piece two pieces to 18 centimeter (7.1 in) x 17 centimeter (6.7 in) shape and seam with 1 centimeter (0.4 in) distance.

steps.headline: Fold 18 centimeter (7.1 in) x 17 centimeter (6.7 in) piece to a 9 centimeter (3.5 in) x 17 centimeter (6.7 in) piece.
steps.description: Sew 15 centimeter (5.9 in) zipper at the folded place.

steps.headline: Cut out 10 centimeter (3.9 in) x 17 centimeter (6.7 in) outside fabric and lining fabric.
steps.description: Piece two pieces to 25 centimeter (9.8 in) x 17 centimeter (6.7 in) shape and seam with 1 centimeter (0.4 in) distance.

steps.headline: Place the 18 centimeter (7.1 in) x 17 centimeter (6.7 in) piece and the 25 centimeter (9.8 in) x 17 centimeter (6.7 in) piece together as shown.
steps.description: Sew the other side of the zipper.

steps.headline: Turn the fabric to the right side.
Sew the right side of zipper again.
steps.description: Add cotton fabric on the back back by sewing.

steps.headline: Make 51.5 centimeter (20.3 in) x 17 centimeter (6.7 in) left inter-layer fabric as following shows: 6 centimeter (2.4 in), 4.5 centimeter (1.8 in), 6 centimeter (2.4 in), 4.5 centimeter (1.8 in), 6 centimeter (2.4 in), 4.5 centimeter (1.8 in) and 20 centimeter (7.9 in) in a line.
Make 18 centimeter (7.1 in) x17cm right inter-lay fabric.
steps.description: Fold the fabric into 9 centimeter (3.5 in) x 17 centimeter (6.7 in) shape.

steps.headline: Combine the outside fabric and inter-layer piece.
Seam the right inter-lay to the right side of the left inter-layer.
steps.description: Baste back-faced outside fabric and inter-layer fabric.

steps.headline: Cut out a strip.
steps.description: Add snap button to the strip.

steps.headline: Sew leather agraffes directly if you do not know how to make snap button to fabric.
Hem the whole edges of the passport holder.

text: Create the fabric as shown.  Cut out 10 centimeter (3.9 in) x 17 centimeter (6.7 in) outside fabric and lining fabric. Piece two pieces to 18 centimeter (7.1 in) x 17 centimeter (6.7 in) shape and seam with 1 centimeter (0.4 in) distance. Fold 18 centimeter (7.1 in) x 17 centimeter (6.7 in) piece to a 9 centimeter (3.5 in) x 17 centimeter (6.7 in) piece. Sew 15 centimeter (5.9 in) zipper at the folded place. Cut out 10 centimeter (3.9 in) x 17 centimeter (6.7 in) outside fabric and lining fabric. Piece two pieces to 25 centimeter (9.8 in) x 17 centimeter (6.7 in) shape and seam with 1 centimeter (0.4 in) distance. Place the 18 centimeter (7.1 in) x 17 centimeter (6.7 in) piece and the 25 centimeter (9.8 in) x 17 centimeter (6.7 in) piece together as shown. Sew the other side of the zipper. Cut the inter-layer pieces.  Turn the fabric to the right side.  Sew the right side of zipper again. Add cotton fabric on the back back by sewing. Make 51.5 centimeter (20.3 in) x 17 centimeter (6.7 in) left inter-layer fabric as following shows: 6 centimeter (2.4 in), 4.5 centimeter (1.8 in), 6 centimeter (2.4 in), 4.5 centimeter (1.8 in), 6 centimeter (2.4 in), 4.5 centimeter (1.8 in) and 20 centimeter (7.9 in) in a line.  Make 18 centimeter (7.1 in) x17cm right inter-lay fabric. Fold the fabric into 9 centimeter (3.5 in) x 17 centimeter (6.7 in) shape. Combine the outside fabric and inter-layer piece.  Seam the right inter-lay to the right side of the left inter-layer. Baste back-faced outside fabric and inter-layer fabric. Cut out a strip. Add snap button to the strip. Sew leather agraffes directly if you do not know how to make snap button to fabric.  Hem the whole edges of the passport holder.
